bathe.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to wash yourself or someone else in a bath
bathe.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I bathed, washed my hair, and got dressed.
He bathed the children and put them to bed.
bathe.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to swim in the sea, a river, or a lake
bathe.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: They bathed in the lake in the moonlight.
bathe.translation[0].definitions[1].note: In everyday English, people usually say go for/have a swim rather than bathe:
They went for a swim in the lake.
bathe.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to wash or cover part of your body with a liquid, especially as a medical treatment
bathe.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: She brought a bowl of water and began to bathe the injured arm.
